name: Mary Lou DAYTON v. Roy F. DAYTON, Appellant

judges: Before NIX, CJ., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, J., dissent and would reach the merits of the case.
parties: Mary Lou DAYTON v. Roy F. DAYTON, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, J., dissent and would reach the merits of the case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Robert L. Webster, Webster & Webster, Uniontown, for appellant.
Nicholas J. Cook, Uniontown, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
506 A.2d 901
Mary Lou DAYTON v. Roy F. DAYTON, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 3, 1986.
Decided April 14, 1986.
Robert L. Webster, Webster & Webster, Uniontown, for appellant.
Nicholas J. Cook, Uniontown, for appellee.
Before NIX, CJ., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
